pageTitle: Graduation Announcements, Graduation Invitations | Pear Tree Greetings
textBeforeTable: Most normal card orders shipped within the U.S. should arrive in 3-8 business days, depending upon the shipping method you choose. This includes 2 days for processing and printing. Shipping & Processing See Holiday Hours We’ll get back to you within 1 business day. We promise. Send us an email Closed Sunday Saturday: 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. CST Monday - Friday: 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. CST Call 800.403.8861 Monday - Friday: 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. CST Saturday & Sunday: 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. CST Live chat online See more frequently asked questions How can I track my order? Once your order ships you will receive an email with tracking information. If you have an account, check order status any time at My Account/Order History. What kind of paper do you use? Premium, 100% recycled, 100 lb. matte-finish card stock (unless otherwise noted). How long will it take to process my order? Most products require 1-2 days to process. See exceptions.
textAfterTable: *For Assembly Services, die-cut designs, and orders of 300 pieces or more, add 1 extra day of processing time. Personalized storybooks, yard signs, posters, wall decals, wall art, easel art, metal wall art, metal ornaments, phone cases, and photo backdrops require extra processing time as specified in product details. These items may be shipped separately. Actual delivery times may vary. International shipments may encounter delays beyond our control when clearing customs. International fees are added to shipping charges at checkout and include taxes, customs fees and import duties. Additional Shipping & Processing Charge Shipping and processing will be billed F.O.B., Freight on Board, shipping point and added to your invoice if your order is not prepaid. We are required by law to collect sales tax on orders shipped where applicable. If your organization is tax exempt, please mail a copy of your exemption certificate to: Pear Tree Greetings 1 Stationery Place Rexburg, ID 83441 Shipping and processing charges are designed to compensate the seller for its shipping costs and help offset the costs for receiving and processing orders, maintaining inventory and related warehousing costs. All charges are subject to a fuel surcharge and/or delivery area surcharge.
